meanings.definition: Fubar (adjective): completely messed up or ruined
meanings.sent1: The fubar computer screen showed nothing but a jumble of colors.
meanings.sent2: The party was fubar when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The fubar puzzle pieces were all mixed up, making it impossible to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her fubar attempt at painting the wall left streaks of different colors everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The fubar car engine made strange noises and refused to start.

meanings.definition: Fubar (verb): to completely mess up or ruin
meanings.sent1: I managed to fubar the recipe by adding salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent2: Please don't fubar the presentation by forgetting your notes.
meanings.sent3: He always finds a way to fubar even the simplest tasks.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to fubar the project deadline caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The storm threatened to fubar our plans for the outdoor picnic.

meanings.definition: Fubar (noun): a situation or thing that is completely messed up or ruined
meanings.sent1: The meeting turned into a fubar when the projector stopped working.
meanings.sent2: The house was a fubar after the wild party last night.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leaky faucet turned into a fubar of epic proportions.
meanings.sent4: The fubar of the traffic jam caused everyone to be late for work.
meanings.sent5: The fubar of the broken vase left glass shards all over the floor.
